address:
Department of Physics and Astronomy, University of Iowa, 
Iowa City, IA 52242}
\maketitle
\begin{abstract}
The recently observed properties of quasiparticle resonant states 
near impurities on the surface of superconducting 
Bi$_2$Sr$_2$CaCu$_2$O$_{8+\delta}$ demonstrate that in-plane Andre\'ev
processes are either absent or phase-incoherent. Analysis of
the spectral and 
spatial details of the electronic structure near a Zn impurity also
suggest an effective magnetic component of the impurity
potential.  Further 
experiments are proposed to clarify whether the effective
moments of nearby impurities are correlated.
\end{abstract
author: Michael E. Flatt\'e
